byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Brit say they will not let hostile power occupy Syria and Lebanon, Brit task in Middle East made difficult; French surrender in Tunis frees Itals for attack on Egypt and Suez Canal; Gen Weygand reptd on way to Syria to protect it from Brit intrigue
snippet: LONDON, July 1--Britain, making her first move in an effort to salvage what she can out of the wreck of France, announced tonight that the government "could not allow Syria or Lebanon to be occupied by any hostile power."...

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICA AND NEAR EAST AREAS

headline.main: BRITISH WARN FOES NOT TO TAKE SYRIA; JOINS DE GAULLE GROUP

lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 1--Britain, making her first move in an effort to salvage what she can out of the wreck of France, announced tonight that the government "could not allow Syria or Lebanon to be occupied by any hostile power."
